Thu, 20 Dec 2012 03:06:38 +0000 http://wordpress.org/?v=2.9.1 en hourly 1 Old and New Boyfriend http://partiallyclips.com/2012/12/19/old-and-new-boyfriend/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=old-and-new-boyfriend http://partiallyclips.com/2012/12/19/old-and-new-boyfriend/#comments Wed, 19 Dec 2012 08:00:00 +0000 shoebox http://partiallyclips.com/2012/12/19/old-and-new-boyfriend/

This is one of those clips that was just screaming for a story.  I don’t think what I came up with is full-on laugh-out-loud funny, but I’m happy with it. The idea of photos in a girl’s bedroom analyzing her relationships with their respective subjects based on how she treated the photos tickles me. I dated [...]]]>

This is one of those clips that was just screaming for a story.  I don’t think what I came up with is full-on laugh-out-loud funny, but I’m happy with it. The idea of photos in a girl’s bedroom analyzing her relationships with their respective subjects based on how she treated the photos tickles me.

I dated a girl for a brief while whose ex, for financial reasons, still lived in the same house with her (I was at the time suffering from a psychological condition called “idiocy.”)  She had dumped him, but all he had to do was make it clear that he was still available, and the first time we had anything even remotely resembling a fight, there he was.  Rebounds tend to suck.

That said, my last rebound was with Mrs. Shoebox, and that was 14 years ago.

Speaking of whom:

MRS. SHOEBOX’S ASSESSMENT OF TODAY’S STRIP: *chortlesnort* That’s fucked up.

Running a bit late, and failed to deliver on the second strip I planned to put up last week.  Sorry about that.  I plead yuletide preparations.  And Killswitch Engage concert.

Hope you guys are enjoying your holiday whatnot!  See you soon!

-=ShoEboX=-

]]> http://partiallyclips.com/2012/12/19/old-and-new-boyfriend/feed/ 2 Doctor’s Office http://partiallyclips.com/2012/12/11/doctors-office/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=doctors-office http://partiallyclips.com/2012/12/11/doctors-office/#comments Tue, 11 Dec 2012 08:00:00 +0000 shoebox http://partiallyclips.com/2012/12/11/doctors-office/

This one’s geared primarily toward my fellow Software Engineers – for those who don’t know what I’m getting at, there’s an agile task estimation methodology called Planning Poker which involves using Fibonacci numbers to estimate tasks.  It works because the uncertainty increases when the numbers get larger, reflecting the fact that coding is easier to [...]]]>

This one’s geared primarily toward my fellow Software Engineers – for those who don’t know what I’m getting at, there’s an agile task estimation methodology called Planning Poker which involves using Fibonacci numbers to estimate tasks.  It works because the uncertainty increases when the numbers get larger, reflecting the fact that coding is easier to estimate accurately when the work is broken down into small well-defined tasks.   It’s actually a pretty good way of estimating work effort, but dammit, I felt like mocking it, so I did.

Originally I was just trying to build a decent joke around the fact that the typical “how much does it hurt on a scale of 1 to 10″ question (a.k.a. the Wong-Baker FACES Pain-rating scale, apparently) has no units, with the more-universal “millisharpstickintheeye” joke as the punchline.  But somehow I couldn’t make that work, so I’m taking the risk of ending with a head-scratcher.  Hoping those of you outside the software world, or those of you in said world who haven’t experienced the glory of Planning Poker, will still find something to enjoy here.  But just in case, there’ll be another strip up later this week.

See you soon!

-=ShoEboX=-

]]> http://partiallyclips.com/2012/12/11/doctors-office/feed/ 16 Couple On Ski Lift http://partiallyclips.com/2012/12/04/couple-on-ski-lift/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=couple-on-ski-lift http://partiallyclips.com/2012/12/04/couple-on-ski-lift/#comments Tue, 04 Dec 2012 08:00:00 +0000 shoebox http://partiallyclips.com/2012/12/04/couple-on-ski-lift/

This is, once again, one of those cases where I don’t know what the hell the original point of this clip art could possibly have been, so I took it as a personal challenge to tell the characters’ story.  The guy kinda looks like he’s talking to an invisible audience, a fact that caused several [...]]]>

This is, once again, one of those cases where I don’t know what the hell the original point of this clip art could possibly have been, so I took it as a personal challenge to tell the characters’ story.  The guy kinda looks like he’s talking to an invisible audience, a fact that caused several false starts until I decided it was best to ignore it and just focus on the situation and the characters’ facial expressions.  The guy looks smug and the woman looks bitchy, and I tried to add some shades of grey to that while building to a very bad joke which I hope I’ve given a chance to shine by dancing around using it as a punchline.

MRS. SHOEBOX’S ASSESSMENT OF TODAY’S STRIP: …Why is she milking her armpit?

Speaking of the missus, her Manic Metals store on Etsy is once again stocked with jewelry and other metalcrafts for your holiday shopping pleasure, with new stuff going up several times a week (unlike some of us, I know…) and she’s also got a shop with non-metal craft thingies under the name Squeeworthy.  For the rest of December, PartiallyClips readers can save 20% in either store by entering in the coupon code CONFLICTOFINTEREST.





Oh, and Rob Balder’s new Erfworld Book 1 hardcover, Hamstard beanie, and/or dwagon plushie would make pretty damned good presents too.



-=ShoEboX=-

]]> http://partiallyclips.com/2012/12/04/couple-on-ski-lift/feed/ 7 Professor http://partiallyclips.com/2012/11/30/professor/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=professor http://partiallyclips.com/2012/11/30/professor/#comments Fri, 30 Nov 2012 08:00:00 +0000 shoebox http://partiallyclips.com/2012/11/30/professor/

Holy crap, a second PartiallyClips strip in the same week!  And a moderately-topical one, at that!   For those of you outside the U.S., here.  This strip’s based on one of my own facebook posts, cuz why not.  I was happy to be able to find a properly smug-looking professor to get the joke across. I’ve mocked [...]]]>

Holy crap, a second PartiallyClips strip in the same week!  And a moderately-topical one, at that!   For those of you outside the U.S., here.  This strip’s based on one of my own facebook posts, cuz why not.  I was happy to be able to find a properly smug-looking professor to get the joke across.

I’ve mocked the lottery for years.  I took prob & stat in college, for crying out loud.  But when I’m asked to participate in a group ticket purchase at my day job, I still often chip in, and I can’t properly justify this.  There’s not a ton of camaraderie or team-building in the collective guessing of numbers, but I guess it’s still kinda neat to be in the same boat with a bunch of people waiting together for a result.  Even though the positive outcome is hopeless, the negative outcome isn’t exactly hard to absorb financially, and it’s something to talk about if nothing else.

I considered rewording this on the basis that the failure of anyone in this classroom to win the lottery doesn’t actually “prove” anything in the mathematical sense, but ultimately decided that the “assisted me in proving” wording left me sufficient wiggle room in that department.

-=ShoEboX=-

We seem to be back from an aggravating and unplanned bout of downtime.  My blood pressure’s slowly returning to normal, and I actually managed to put together a strip that I believe qualifies as “cute.”

I originally wrote this one using clip art that just showed a girl sitting at a desk, and had her interacting with an unseen parent.  But then I accidentally happened upon this piece, and decided to redo the strip.  Something about the parent actually being in the room smiling lovingly down at her child makes the dialog work a lot better, even though it totally looks like she has braces (she doesn’t – I’ve zoomed in.)

-=ShoEboX=-

UPDATE: Yeowza.  The site was down for quite a while there.  We’re finally back, and everything appears to still be here.  New strip will be going up tonight – thanks for your patience!  We now return you to your regular commentary.

–(snip)–

YouTube pop culture clarification, just in case:  Exhibit A and Exhibit B

“HONORABLE” MENTION:  “Don’t go chasing waterfowl….”

The “fake ducks” line actually went through my head quite a while ago when I saw a truck with personalized license plate reading – I swear to god – “DCOY NUT,” and my brain decided that this was the song that the driver should be cranking.

MRS. SHOEBOX’S ASSESSMENT OF TODAY’S STRIP: *initial chortle, evolving into several seconds of full-on out-loud laughter*

]]> http://partiallyclips.com/2012/11/18/woodworker/feed/ 6 Gambling http://partiallyclips.com/2012/11/12/gambling/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=gambling http://partiallyclips.com/2012/11/12/gambling/#comments Mon, 12 Nov 2012 08:00:00 +0000 shoebox http://partiallyclips.com/2012/11/12/gambling/

This was one of the “sample” bits of clip art Rob gave me when he first asked me to take over the strip.  It took me this long to figure out what to do with it! Every idea I had with this piece had something to do with video card games becoming the norm and actual [...]]]>

This was one of the “sample” bits of clip art Rob gave me when he first asked me to take over the strip.  It took me this long to figure out what to do with it!

Every idea I had with this piece had something to do with video card games becoming the norm and actual physical card games becoming the exception, and once again it was one of those things where every idea became far too wordy to fit in three panels.  The one with cowboys complaining about how a mechanical decision-makin’ contraption could never replace a real player because they wouldn’t be able to flip a table seemed the most promising, but ultimately I had to pick a direction I could go in without having to connect too many dots.

Don’t get me wrong, I love the fact that I have a seemingly-unlimited number of games available in my pocket at any given moment.  But there’s a big difference between sneaking in a few minutes of Words With Friends on your lunch break and having a loud happy evening of Dixit with actual friends.

-=ShoEboX=-

In the midst of preparing for whatever parts of Hurricane Sandy feel like visiting Rochester (I fixed a battery-backup sump pump today! Sort of!) and getting ready for my CD release show (Tuesday at the Bug Jar here in Rochester!) I managed to throw together this here strip.  This one started from the…

Ohhh shit, lights flickered.  We’re about to lose power.  Uploading now.  More commentary later if  I can. Stay safe, folks.

-=ShoEboX=-

UPDATE: Okay, false alarm, at least for now.   Anyway, this one’s a very simple joke, but I like to think I made at least a somewhat better joke by throwing a monster with bad grammar in the mix.

MRS. SHOEBOX’S ASSESSMENT OF TODAY’S STRIP: That’s very weird.  That’s very very weird.  I like it.

]]> http://partiallyclips.com/2012/10/29/slime-monster/feed/ 3 Astronauts http://partiallyclips.com/2012/10/21/astronauts/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=astronauts http://partiallyclips.com/2012/10/21/astronauts/#comments Sun, 21 Oct 2012 08:00:00 +0000 shoebox http://partiallyclips.com/2012/10/21/astronauts/

I watched the recent space jump with my seven-year-old son, seeing a glimmer in his eyes that reminded me of how the shuttle launches I watched at his age blew my mind.  There was always awe, always a feeling of being there for something important and new, and always fear of what would happen if [...]]]>

I watched the recent space jump with my seven-year-old son, seeing a glimmer in his eyes that reminded me of how the shuttle launches I watched at his age blew my mind.  There was always awe, always a feeling of being there for something important and new, and always fear of what would happen if things went awry.  But everything went gloriously well, and it was amazing to watch this unfold.

And, of course, it was sponsored by Red Bull.

I initially thought that putting Red Bull in the strip would be too on-the-nose – I threw Crystal Pepsi in as the beverage, and then I tried with Zima, but both my wife AND Rob reminded me that it’s friggin’ 2012.  Rob thought that just sticking with Red Bull was the way to go (and suggested the final “moon” line,) and I think he was right.  But, y’know, Surge would also have totally worked. Just sayin’.

In other news, for those of you in the NYC area, I’m playing a show with Devo Spice at Broadway’s in Times Square on Wednesday the 24th (tickets and info here)

-=ShoEboX=–
